intro: Toxocarpus decaryi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 cm and thrives in humid, well-drained environments. Its foliage is often velvety and dark green, with flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
